snippet: With a contested convention a possibility, Republicans are turning their attention to the byzantine contests used to select individual delegates.
abstract: Presidential campaigns of Donald J Trump and Sen Ted Cruz have begun carefully selecting individual delegates who will attend Republican National Convention in Cleveland; process could be pivotal if convention is contested, as many delegates will become free agents if no candidate wins majority on first ballot.

byline.contributor: Jonathan Martin contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: With a contested convention a possibility, Republicans are turning their attention to the byzantine contests used to select individual delegates.

headline.main: Republicans Enter a Shadow Campaign to Sew Up Delegates
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Enters Shadow Race for Delegates
